oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Campbell Chapel AME: front view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Campbell Chapel African Methodist Episcopal Church

Black and white photograph of a stone church with a three-tiered edifice and gable roof; tower with steeple on left; on the front facade are two rectangle stained glass windows, two pointed arch stained glass windows, and one arched stained glass window; small vent beneath peak of roof; on square tower is a conical steeple with three visible dormers; small sign in front of building

Named in honor of of Bishop J.P. Campbell of the AME conference, Campbell Chapel was the first AME congregation in Giles County. It was established in 1925 in Pulaski, TN, and has since established a reputation for community leadership among African Americans there.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
